inclusion.criterion: Data collection Respondents are identified through the National Population Register (DSF)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The data collection takes place using a postal questionnaire
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Baseline: Data collection before the intervention is implemented to assess breastfeeding prevalence and distribution of covariates in the two study arms.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Post-survey: The post-survey to assess the effect, will take place about two years after baseline when the community health services have been certified.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Sample size It is expected that the project could increase the breastfeeding prevalence with 5 percentage points. This assumption is the basis for the sample size.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In 2007 the Norwegian Government launched The Norwegian Action Plan on Nutrition (2007-2011) which emphasizes breast milk as optimal nutrition as well as being one of the most effective ways to promote health and prevent disease.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Almost all women produce breast milk, but the act of breastfeeding is a complicated interaction between mother and child and is affected by a number of factors.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The National Resource Centre for Breastfeeding (NRCB) is cooperating with Norwegian Public Health Nurses Association and the Norwegian Directorate of Health in the initiative Baby-Friendly Community Health Services (BFCHS).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A newly updated Cochrane-overview about the effect of offering support to breastfeeding mothers identified 16 studies which assessed the effect of support from health workers.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The disparity in breastfeeding between different socioeconomic groups in Norway primarily follows the same pattern as that found in health generally.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Improving health service access to the entire population would contribute to advancing the health and health promoting behavior in those groups with the poorest prospects.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: While WHO has developed an international standard for breastfeeding counseling for maternity wards, there is no similar standard for primary care services as yet.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Mothers who do not understand Norwegian
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Mothers with infants below five months and above twelve months age
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

notes: The patient is a 5-month-old male with an undescended testis, but the trial's focus on breastfeeding makes him eligible.
